content: end of row- 5sts cut yarn leaving a tail end to sew the seam with thread end through all 5 sts pull up to gather and secure the end for the chilli point leaf top with yarn b cast on 18 sts row 1-3 beginning with a purl row work three row stocking stitch row 4 k4 k2tog three times - 15sts row 5 & 7 purl row 6 k3 k2tog three times - 12sts row 8 k2tog six times - 6sts row 9-12 *work stocking stitch i-cord all knit for four row then cast off all 6 stalk top sts fig 1 fig 2 *note instead of i-cord you can work four row stocking stitch beginning with a purl row and sew the seam afterwards before you sew the seam at the back of the chilli you need to fix the balloon light into the stalk and top of the chilli as follows attend to the light the very first thing to do is to apply a little bit of glue to the top of the white stopper that which switches the light off/ on from the balloon light and then push the glued stopper into the leaf top stalk i-cord - see fig 1 when you ve done that apply a little bit of glue to the actual light itself then wrap the top of the chilli around the glue to adhere it to the light what you are wanting is for the stopper to be pulled out sufficiently to switch the light on without the stopper actually leaving the light entirely - see figs 2 & 3 fig 3 fig 4 chilli lantern page 14 chilli lantern page 15 now join the seam at the back of the chilli - i used whip stitch for this joining the chilli if you d want to add the chilli to the string of fairy lights instead continue as row ends with mattress stitch from the fastened-off chilli point to the cast-on edge at the follows same time wrapping around the light - see fig 3 & 4 join the seam that runs along the back of the chilli - i used whip stitch for this pass the fairy light bulb into the stalk i-cord then close/ secure the top of the note as an added/ optional extra and you could give the chilli an authentic shape by stalk around the wires near the top of the fairy light bulb with some careful gluing a length of wire against the back seam - see fig 4 stitching - see fig 7 lastly place the chilli leaf top over the chilli s cast-on edge join the seam at the back of the leaf top with mattress stitch then whip stitch to join the edge of the leaf tip to the cast- on edge so fixing the light stopper into the light -
